Name: Defense Procurement Strategy
Description:
The Defense Procurement Strategy, announced on February 5, 2014, was created to improve defence procurement for the Government of Canada.  The objectives are to deliver the right equipment to the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast guard quickly and efficiently, leverage our purchases of defense equipment to create jobs and increase economic growth, and streamline defense procurement processes. The Defence Procurement Strategy will continue to look at all aspects of defence procurements and initiate additional transformation initiatives to ensure alignment between the departments.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in Acquisitions Branch do their work and will require some training.

Transformation Timeline Tool Lead: Michael Brunetti, Defense Procurement Strategy Secretariat.

Click here to read more.

Events.Text: New governance processes are being developed and streamlined for Defence Procurements (above $20 million) and for certain Canadian Coast Guard procurements (Over $100 million in which a National Security Exception applies). Defense Procurement Strategy Secretariat (DPSS) will continue to provide the Contracting Community with support and guidance on the implementation of these new processes as required.
Events.Hover: New governance processes and ongoing support for Defense Procurements (Click on the Red Dot icon to read more)
Online E-Learning courses will provide general awareness and information regarding the DPS and its impact on the work of Contracting Officers.

In-class training for employees who work more directly with the implementation of the Defense Procurement Strategy. This training will have a more in-depth focus on several important elements such as the strategy’s application, governance and value proposition.

Events.Text: Since February 2015, the Defence Procurement Strategy Secretariat (DPSS) has welcomed new members with a wide range of experience ranging from Defence Program Management, Procurement and Policy Analysis. Given the interdepartmental focus of the Secretariat, several of these new members have been brought in from other government departments. DPSS will continue to add to its growing team of experts over the coming months.
Events.Hover: We are welcoming new members to the Defence Procurement Strategy Secretariat (DPSS) (Click on the Red Dot icon to read more)

Name: Case and Client Relationship Management (PSPC)
Description:
This initiative was created to provide a shared case management solution to branches and sectors within PWGSC. Aligned with the Government’s IT strategy, this System allows the user to manage activities, tasks and workflow processes.

This initiative will affect the way employees do their work and will require training.

Transformation Timeline Tool Leads: Claude Kateb (Departmental Oversight Branch) and Kim Steel (Chief Information Office Branch

August 25, 2016: The Case Management Solution for the Public Service Pay Centre (PSCP) Pay Case in the Accounting, Banking, and Compensation Branch goes live.

Name: Acquisitions Program Transformation
Description:
The Acquisitions Program Transformation is made up of projects and activities that will change how we do procurement. This initiative will focus on four main strategies: Implementing smart procurement strategies, which means solving problems for our clients while maintaining our core values; leveraging digital technology so that employees have the right tools to do their job; supporting our people by fostering an open and innovative environment; and creating financial sustainability so that we can make more informed financial decisions.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in the Acquisitions Branch do their work and will require some training.

Acquisitions Program Transformation Timeline Tool Lead: Vicki Ghadban, Acquisitions Branch

Click here to read more.

Name: GCDOCS (Government Wide)
Description:
GCDOCS is the official enterprise document and records management solution of the Government of Canada. In simple terms, it’s a tool that organizations can use to create, collect and preserve data. It also has a dual function; organizations can use GCDOCS as a collaborative tool by easily sharing, organizing, evaluating, identifying and disposing of data. This initiative will be rolled out across the Government of Canada as departments and agencies commit to this tool.

This initiative will not affect the way employees do their work and will not require training.

GCDOCS (Government Wide) Transformation Timeline Tool Lead: Marie-Claude Renaud, Chief Information Branch

Click here to read more.

Events.Hover: Development of the GCDOCS solution is complete. Wave 1 (11 Departments / 35,000 users) installation and configuration starts.

Wave 1 installation and configuration complete.
Wave 3 (23 Departments / 75,000 users) installation and configuration starts
Wave 4 (6 Departments / 27,000 users) installation and configuration starts

The government-wide GCDOCS service is now hosted on the Shared Services Canada end-state production environment

Canadian Northern Economic Development Agency (CanNor), Veterans Affairs Canada (VAC) and Natural Resources Canada (NRCAN) current GCODCS service moved to the Shared Services Canada end-state production environment.
Wave 2 installation and configuration complete.
Wave 3 installation and configuration complete.

Name: Shared Case Management (Government Wide)
Description:
This initiative was created to provide a shared case management solution to departments and agencies across the Government of Canada. Aligned with the Government’s IT strategy, this System allows the user to manage activities, tasks and workflow processes.

This initiative will not affect the way employees do their work and will not require training.

Shared Case Management System (Government Wide) Lead: Todd Biggs, Integrated Services Branch

Name: Email Transformation (PSPC internal)
Description:
Email transformation will consolidate email systems into one consolidated, modern system. Under this initiative, all government email addresses will be simplified to the @canada.ca suffix so that communication with citizens, business and each other will be enhanced. Email Transformation will also work towards reducing cyber threats.

This initiative may affect the way employees do their work and may require employees to take training.

Click here to read more.

The Transformation Lead is: Kim Steel, Chief Information Officer Branch

In the regions, the Transformation Leads are the Regional Directors of Corporate Services, Strategic Management and Communications:

Atlantic: Anne Thomas
Ontario: Johanne Tremblay
Quebec: Richard Gagnon
West: Mark Harrison
Pacific: Ryan Beattie

Events.Hover: Internet Explorer 11 is deployed (August 30, 2015). MS Office 13, including Outlook 13 is deployed (end of September 2015).
E-Vault is decommissioned (September 30, 2015).

Events.Text:
Transition to @canada.ca begins May 22-june 17, 2016:

  • Impacts: E-mail will be unavailable from 6pm to 6am on transition nights.
  • Blackberry’s will be unavailable until after 11 am day after transition.
  • E-mail passwords will have to be reset.
  • New Help Desk Procedures will be made available
  • Impact to end users will vary greatly depending on how well they assimilate the messages and instructions provided.
  • There will some issues of coexistence between accounts that have been migrated to @canada.ca versus those that are still on the legacy system. These issues will be mitigated by transferring entire branches each night. If resources, boardrooms or schedules bridge across branches then this might be a problem.
Events.Hover: Employees’ email accounts begin to migrate to the new @canada.ca (May 22, 2016). (Click on the Red dot icon to read more)
Migration of email accounts to the new @canada.ca is complete (June 17, 2016). A total of 22,824 new accounts have been successfully migrated.
November 2015-March 2016: Monthly Reminder notices to employees to reduce the size of their mailboxes to less than 500 Mb
Final reminder to employees to reduce the size of their mailboxes to less than 500mb. Transition notices of upcoming ETI migration begin
Enrollment into new system via Service Delivery Portal (SDP). Additional Transition Notices will be sent to employees.

Name: GCDOCS (PSPC internal)
Description:
GCDOCS is the Government of Canada’s solution to managing corporate information. Led by PSPC, GCDOCS is an enterprise document and records management solution that offers version control, a powerful search capability and a collaborative environment. GCDOCS is proving to be a valuable archiving and information system and was launched at PSPC in fall 2015.

This initiative will affect the way employees do their work and will require training.

Name: Imaging Centre of Expertise for Government
Description:
As a new vehicle for service delivery, PWGSC is working to develop a Centre of Expertise that would be responsible for delivering imaging services for the Government of Canada. This Centre of Expertise would provide common services and be the sole contracting authority for government-wide imaging requirements.

This initiative will not affect the way employees do their work and will not require any training.

Imaging Centre of Expertise Lead: Mike Fabbro, Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch

Click here to read more.

Name: NOVUS Real Property Business Systems Transformation
Description:
The NOVUS solution, or SIGMA Real Property, replaces several stand-alone IT systems and aligns with real property and general business processes. The solution results in greater integration of both sector and branch level operations to improve the way that PWGSC employees carry out their day-to-day work. It will also help the Real Property branch within PWGSC manage its real estate portfolio more strategically.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in Real Property Branch do their work and will require training.

The Novus Solutions Transformation National Timeline Tool Lead: Eloise Lyon, Real Property Branch

Click here to read more.

Events.Text: The technical solution for NOVUS is integrated with the existing PWGSC SAP solution for Finance – called SIGMA. The integrated solution for both finance and real property processes will be referred to collectively as SIGMA. Technical Release 1: Late June 2014. Technical Release 2: Late November 2014
Events.Hover: NOVUS is integrated with SIGMA. (Click on the Red Dot icon to read more)

Name: Next Generation Shared Travel Services
Description:
Launched in 2014-15, this new travel services system was developed to help control and reduce costs related to travel. The Government procured this new service provider so that it could offer a more powerful technology for booking and managing Government-related travel. This, of course, has led to overall further efficiencies throughout the Government of Canada.

This initiative will affect the way some employees throughout the department do their work and will require training for these employees.

The Transformation Lead is: Simon Fradette, Integrated Services Branch

Click here to read more.

Name: RP-1 / RP-n
Description:
In place since April 2015, this real property initiative was put in place to increase our agility as a real property service provider and provide a higher value to our clients.

RP-n: Real Property contracts (referred to as RP-n) represent an approach where the department maintains responsibility for the management and oversight of services, but leverage the private sector’s innovation and agility for delivery of services.

RP-1: The RP-1 contracts consist of six regional, performance-based contracts that provide a comprehensive range of real property services in PWGSC and selected other government department (OGD) custodial facilities, lease-purchase and leased properties across Canada.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in Real Property Branch do their work and will require training for these employees.

Real Property (RP-1, RP-n) Transformation Timeline Tool Lead: Nathalie Laliberte, Real Property Branch

Click here to read more.

Events.Hover: On April 1, 2015 PWGSC began a new facilities management and services contract with Brookfield Global Integrated Solutions (BGIS) Canada. The term of the contract is 14 years if all options are exercised (March 31, 2028).

Events.Text: RP-n Oversight Committee is established. The role of the committee is to ensure overall performance of RP contracts, to ensure continued adherence of the departmental objectives and priorities, to review the implementation of the framework to ensure effectiveness, consistency and continuous improvement.

Name: Transformation of Pension Administration
Description:
The Transformation of Pension Administration Initiative was established in 2007 to modernize the systems and processes that support pension administration for public servants, and to centralize the delivery of services in Shediac, New Brunswick.

Treasury Board Ministers provided authority (2010 - Royal Canadian Mounted Police; 2011 - Canadian Armed Forces) to transfer the administration of additional pension plans to PWGSC, based on the new solution. Transfer of plan administration to the new solution was completed in 2013 for public servants, in 2014 for RCMP, and is on track for transfer of Canadian Armed Forces pension administration to PWGSC in 2016.

Benefits of the new solution include improved, more cost-effective services, increased accuracy and security, web-based self-service options, elimination of paper files, and alignment to common Government of Canada pension services and standards.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in the Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch do their work and will require training for these employees.

Lead of the Transformation of Pension Administration for the Transformation Timeline Tool: Jeff Marcantonio, Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch

Click here to read more.

Events.Hover: Project start-up and planning activities for Release 1 (Canadian Forces Regular and Reserve Force Contributors) and Release 2 (Canadian Forces Regular and Reserve Force Annuitants) is complete.
Detailed design and development of Release 1 (Canadian Forces Regular and Reserve Force Contributors) is complete.

Events.Text:
Release 1.0 training sessions for 40 PWGSC Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch employees in HQ (new Government of Canada Pension Centre):

  1. Pension Solution Training (in class, instructed), Covers the use of the new pension solution components - Siebel, Penfax, and Genesys - and includes training on the new business processes and procedures;
  2. Client Service Soft Skills Training (in class, instructed): Three Client Service Excellence courses custom tailored by Canada School of Public Service will be provided to pension administration staff (B175 Communicating Client Service; B176 Analyzing Client Service and B177 Challenging Client Service.) Check the CSPS website for course availability.
  3. Change Management Training (in class, instructed): Provides the necessary training and support to management to lead their employees through the changes;
  4. Canadian Forces Superannuation Act (CFSA) Plan Training (in class, instructed): Provides an overview of the CFSA pension plan specific to its legislation, business rules and pension rules. It is required by new resources corresponding with their roles within the new organization.
Events.Hover: Release 1.0 training sessions for 40 PWGSC Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch employees in HQ (new Government of Canada Pension Centre). Click on the Book icon to read more.

October 2016 – December 2016: Release 2.0 end user training - for retired plan member functionality.

Name: Pay Consolidation Project
Description:
This Project falls under the Transformation of Pay Administration Initiative umbrella, launched in 2009, and includes the 46 departments and agencies were using or planning to use the PeopleSoft software when the Treasury Board Submission was approved in 2011. Its goal is to gradually consolidate pay services of participating departments and agencies to the new Public Service Pay Centre in Miramichi, NB, with limited disruption for employees.

This initiative will affect the way some employees in the Accounting Banking and Compensation Branch do their work and will require training for these employees.

The Transformation of Pay Administration Transformation Timeline Tool Lead: Kristine Renic, Transformaton of Pay Administration

Click here to read more.

Events.Hover: Approximately 92,000 accounts will be serviced by the Public Service Pay Centre in Miramichi completing the scope of the Consolidation of Pay Services Project.

Construction complete on new the new Pay Centre.
Phased move of employees to the new Pay Centre completed.

Name: Pay Modernization Project
Description:
The Pay Modernization Project was developed under the government-wide Transformation of Pay Administration Initiative to replace the Government’s outdated pay system. Launching in the fall 2015, the new pay system, known as Phoenix, will offer employees a simpler, more effective way to access and update their personal information. It will also be seamlessly integrated with the PeopleSoft program, and will renew the delivery of pay services by streamlining and modernizing business processes.

Pay Modernization Project Transformation Timeline Lead: Kristine Renic, Accounting, Banking and Compensation Branch

This initiative will affect the way all employees do their work and will require training.

Click here to read more.

Events.Hover: Design, build and test phases of Phoenix are complete.

Name: PSPC Accommodation Renewal Initiative
Description:
The Accommodation Renewal initiative was developed to create a modern workplace that will attract, retain and encourage public servants to work smarter, greener and healthier to better serve Canadians. Focusing on three pillars of change, namely the workplace, the back office, and the way we work, Accommodation Renewal will change the way we work and collaborate to conduct our day-to-day business. This initiative will be rolled out in various branches throughout the coming years, and has already been championed in several regions across the department.

This initiative will affect the way employees do their work and will require training.

Click here to read more.

Transformation Lead:  André-Guy Chéchippe, Finance & Administration Branch

In the regions, the Transformation Leads are the Regional Directors of Corporate Services, Strategic Management and Communications:

Atlantic: Anne Thomas
Ontario: Johanne Tremblay
Quebec: Richard Gagnon
West: Mark Harrison
Pacific: Ryan Beattie

Name: Mental Health Strategy/Well-being Dashboard
Description:
Mental Health and Well-being in the Workplace are emerging and important issues. PSPC is taking a proactive, integrated approach to ensure that employees across the Department are well supported on all aspects of mental health and well-being. HRB already provides a number of programs and activities that support employees, from employee and organization assistance and conflict management to return to work support. By integrating these activities, PSPC will provide a broad level of support to employees through awareness and education, tools and guidance, and a long-term strategy to build capacity and expertise in the organization.

The development of a PSPC Well-being Strategy, of which Mental Health and a Well-being Dashboard are an integrated part. The Well-being Strategy will promote workplace well-being and an increase in employees’ wellness by identifying areas of the department with issues in order to provide managers with the tools to help resolve them.

Events.Hover: Review of mental health programs in other government departments
Overview of existing programs at PSPC and gap analysis
Presentation to HRC of new Well-being Strategy (which includes Mental Health and new Well-being Dashboard
Announcement of the creation of a new Well-being Program at PSPC
review of Mental Health Tasks Force recommendations
statistical analysis completed for department
Strategy to move forward

Name: Workshop on Mental Health and Employee Well-being
Description:
The main objectives of the session are:

  • A better understanding of mental health
  • Knowledge of signs of mental illness at work
  • Understanding of your role as an employee and a manager
  • Becoming familiar with the resources
A new case study can be developed for each specific branch, if needed

Name: Telework/Alternate Work Arrangements
Description: Workplace 2.0, improvements in technology and employee expectations are all drivers in the effort to increase telework and alternate work arrangements. HRB is working closely with branches and regions to share best practices and provide support to increase telework opportunities across the Department. The adoption of telework and alternate work arrangements supports our Department’s efforts to be an innovative work place of choice. Promote telework to managers and employees, provide information and tools, eliminate myths and provide overview of successful implementation at the Translation Bureau.

Events.Text:
Presentation at EXCO

  • Percentage of potential suitable positions was identified in each branch/region’s
  • Telework Guidelines details and Web Links will be reviewed
  • A Communication plan for a phased telework implementation will be created and presented to EXCO for approval
  • Promotional Video showcasing current teleworkers success will be prepared
  • CIOB will work on ensuring the technology can support telework on a broader scale as implementation phases in.
  • Branches & Regions will start implementation of new telework by April 1, 2016
Events.Hover: Presentation at EXCO
